item.title: 'VAR has to rein its neck in' - how I'd change football for the fans
item.description: In his BBC Sport column, former Premier League manager Tony Pulis looks at which laws he would change in football.

item.title: Ex-Chelsea player Oscar in hospital with heart issue
item.description: Former Chelsea and Brazil midfielder Oscar is stable in hospital after falling unwell with a heart issue.

item.title: How Arteta-McVay bond helped Arsenal & Rams become title contenders
item.description: The head coaches of the Los Angeles Rams and Arsenal, teams from different sports in the same ownership group, have developed a bond that has helped both become title contenders.

item.title: James hoping for later World Cup kick-off times
item.description: England defender Reece James hopes Fifa will consider moving kick-off times for next year's World Cup to help players deal with potentially stifling summer temperatures.

item.title: Man Utd want to use historic Old Trafford match to 'push team forward'
item.description: Manchester United's Champions League match with Paris St-Germain will be a historic occasion at Old Trafford, but will it become a more regular occurrence?

item.title: Could a stopped clock end time-wasting in football?
item.description: Would a game of two halves of 30 minutes, with the watch stopped when the ball is out, really improve football?

item.title: Euro 2028 bid a 'massive' motivation for Bellamy
item.description: Craig Bellamy says the prospect of managing Wales at a major tournament on home soil is a "massive" motivation as he looks ahead to Euro 2028.

item.title: 'Longevity defines him' - how long will Ronaldo go on?
item.description: As Cristiano Ronaldo prepares to return to Dublin, 16 years after playing his first Real Madrid game in the Irish capital, BBC Sport NI looks at the 40-year-old's longevity.

item.title: Man Utd keen on German teenager - Wednesday's gossip
item.description: Manchester United in the hunt for highly rated German midfielder Kennet Eichhorn, while four Premier League clubs want Arsenal's Myles Lewis-Skelly, plus more.

item.title: 'Mad scientist' & 'next Luis Enrique' - who is Celtic-linked Wilfried Nancy?
item.description: Kheredine Idessane speaks to an MLS expert about Columbus Crew head coach Wilfried Nancy, who has been linked with Celtic.

item.title: O'Neill gives me 'freedom' to score goals - Price
item.description: Northern Ireland midfielder Isaac Price credits his international goalscoring exploits to the fact that manager Michael O'Neill encourages him to get into attacking positions.

item.title: England's place is booked - what's still at stake in final World Cup qualifiers?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything team looks at who has qualified for next year's Fifa World Cup.

item.title: Norwich hold talks with O'Neil, Tomasson and Still
item.description: Norwich hold talks with Gary O'Neil, Will Still and Jon Dahl Tomasson in their search to find a new manager following Liam Manning's dismissal.

item.title: Fifa accused of creating 'fake' player unions
item.description: Fifa is not engaging with "recognised football representative bodies", says world players' union Fifpro.

item.title: Webb backs officials over disallowed Liverpool goal
item.description: Howard Webb insists it was "not unreasonable" for Virgil van Dijk's goal to be disallowed for offside against Manchester City

item.title: Kerr 'relishing every moment' after first Chelsea start in 692 days
item.description: Sam Kerr made a triumphant return to the Chelsea starting line-up with two goals in a 6-0 thrashing of St Polten in the Women's Champions League.

item.title: Rising Ballers to Premier League: Ndiaye's unusual route to top
item.description: The French-born footballer did not have an easy run on his way to the top, with numerous clubs rejecting him.

item.title: Follow your club with BBC Sport
item.description: BBC Sport brings you the latest news, punditry, analysis, fan views, stats and gossip on your favourite club.

item.title: Ndiaye's rise from Sunday league YouTube side to Premier League
item.description: Everton's Iliman Ndiaye talks to BBC Newsbeat's Abu Bakar Yasin about his football journey.

item.title: 'My whole dream was to play Champions League football'
item.description: Maya Le Tissier talks to BBC Sport's Simon Stone before Man Utd's first Women's Champions League match at Old Trafford against PSG on Wednesday.

item.title: What would pundits change about football?
item.description: Imagine a world in which you could reinvent football... BBC Sport's pundits share what they would change.

item.title: 'It's a dream come true' - Scott on first England call-up
item.description: Bournemouth midfielder Alex Scott says he is "over the moon" to receive his first senior England call-up for the World Cup qualifiers against Serbia and Albania.

item.title: Thompson's 'audacious' opener features in WSL's best goals
item.description: Alyssa Thompson's first league goal and Eveliina Summanen's stunning free-kick feature in the best goals from this weekend's Women's Super League.

item.title: Spain 'surprise' at Lamine Yamal groin procedure
item.description: The Spanish Football Association says it did not know about winger Lamine Yamal's groin procedure on the day the squad began a training camp.

item.title: Gannon-Doak 'has no doubt' Scotland will reach World Cup
item.description: Birthday boy Ben Gannon-Doak has "no doubt" Scotland will end a 28-year wait and reach the 2026 World Cup.

item.title: 'Written in the stars' - but Earps expects boos on Man Utd return
item.description: Paris St-Germain keeper Mary Earps says a return to former club Manchester United was 'written in the stars', but expects some booing in Wednesday's Champions League tie.

item.title: Hillsborough survivor anger at BBC MacKenzie interview
item.description: A Hillsborough survivor described the decision to interview the former Sun editor as an "insult".

item.title: FA charges Mejbri for allegedly spitting at fans
item.description: Burnley midfielder Hannibal Mejbri is charged with misconduct by the FA for allegedly spitting at Leeds fans last month.

item.title: Cardiff comeback knocks Arsenal U21s out - EFL Trophy round-up
item.description: League One side Cardiff City come from behind to beat 10-man Arsenal Under-21s 2-1, eliminating the Premier League club from the EFL Trophy.

item.title: Sheehan sacked as Swansea City head coach
item.description: Alan Sheehan leaves his role as head coach of Swansea City following the club's poor start to the Championship season.

item.title: Reinventing Football - five things fans would change
item.description: BBC Sport asked football fans to rip up the rulebook and suggest one change to the game. Here are the top five talking points from thousands of replies.

item.title: Chalobah and Trafford called up to England squad
item.description: Chelsea defender Trevoh Chalobah and Manchester City keeper James Trafford are called up to the England squad following the withdrawals of Newcastle United's Anthony Gordon and Nick Pope.

item.title: Scotland face 'play-off before the play-offs'
item.description: Scotland face "the play-off before the play-offs" against Greece and Denmark in pursuit of a World Cup place, says assistant coach Steven Naismith.

item.title: Magennis praises NI 'fearlessness and athleticism'
item.description: Northern Ireland striker Josh Magennis highlights some of the qualities he believes have helped Michael O'Neill's side become a force to be reckoned with again.

item.title: Ronaldo confirms 2026 World Cup will be his last
item.description: Portugal striker Cristiano Ronaldo says the 2026 World Cup will be his last.

item.title: Iwobi ready for 'big brother' Aubameyang in play-off test
item.description: Alex Iwobi says Nigeria will have to "lock up" Gabon striker, and his former Arsenal team-mate, Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang when the sides meet in African play-offs for the 2026 World Cup.

item.title: 1,000 games in, Guardiola has new energy for new era
item.description: Sunday began with a celebration of Pep Guardiola and ended in the same manner, with the Manchester City boss showing he has new energy in a new era for the club.

item.title: Arsenal and Palace games moved to ease congestion
item.description: The Premier League agrees to move games involving Arsenal and Crystal Palace in December to ease concerns over fixture congestion.

item.title: 'Governing bodies must listen over ACL injuries'
item.description: Governing bodies must address the congested fixture schedule, says England midfielder Keira Walsh after Arsenal defender Katie Reid is ruled out for season with injury.

item.title: Patience and belief key to Wrexham's upward trajectory
item.description: With 15 Championship matches played, BBC Sport Wales takes stock of Wrexham's league campaign so far.

item.title: Davies, Cabango and Moore withdraw from Wales squad
item.description: Ben Davies, Ben Cabango and Kieffer Moore will miss Wales' final World Cup qualifying group games against Liechtenstein and North Macedonia due to injury.

item.title: Turkey FA suspends 1,024 players in betting probe
item.description: The Turkish Football Federation suspends 1,024 players from its professional leagues as part of an investigation into betting.

item.title: What do Northern Ireland need to secure World Cup play-off?
item.description: With two World Cup qualifying fixtures remaining, where do Northern Ireland stand in the play-off picture for the tournament next summer?

item.title: Hoardings, showers & pink dressing rooms - the 'creative' ways clubs get an edge
item.description: After Sunderland moved advertising hoardings to stifle Arsenal's long throws, BBC Sport looks at some other creative ways teams have tried to gain an advantage.

item.title: Do you know these players from the Women's Champions League?
item.description: Think you know your women's footballers? See if you recognise the 10 we have selected.

item.title: Records and goals - how 'winner' Rodon found home at Leeds
item.description: Wales defender Joe Rodon, who wears his heart on his sleeve, is finally showcasing both his defensive and attacking capabilities in the Premier League.

item.title: Republic of Ireland 'always a dream' for US-born O'Toole
item.description: United States-born defender Kevin O'Toole says his call-up to the Republic of Ireland squad for the forthcoming double-header against Portugal and Hungary represents the fulfilment of a dream.

item.title: How can Scotland qualify for 2026 World Cup?
item.description: Scotland will finish either first or second in their World Cup qualification group. But how do they reach the finals?

item.title: Collins 'didn't understand' Ronaldo celebration
item.description: Republic of Ireland captain Nathan Collins says he "doesn't know" why Cristiano Ronaldo celebrated Ruben Neves' late winner in front of Jake O'Brien's face when the teams met in October.

item.title: Does a change in manager lead to more injuries?
item.description: Physiotherapist Ben Warburton says it's "very well known" that a new coach of a team will prompt "an increase of injury incidence".

item.title: 'It can't go on' - how Liverpool's tactics helped brilliant Doku run riot
item.description: Jeremy Doku was in superb form to help Manchester City beat Liverpool on Sunday, but MOTD pundit Danny Murphy explains how the way the Reds set up made it easier for the Belgium winger to shine.

item.title: Who has made Troy's Premier League team of the week?
item.description: After every round of Premier League matches this season, Troy Deeney gives us his team of the week. Do you agree with his choices?

item.title: 'Man City make ominous statement in brutal lesson for Liverpool'
item.description: Manchester City deliver an ominous statement of intent by outclassing Liverpool in Pep Guardiola's 1,000th match as a manager, says Phil McNulty.

item.title: Hayes on her feminist dad, anxiety and feeling like a grandparent to players
item.description: Emma Hayes sits down with Kelly Somers to talk about her childhood, working as a national team boss and balancing football with family.

item.title: Transfers - September to December 2025
item.description: Check out the significant signings and departures in the Premier League, Scottish Premiership, EFL and Women's Super League.

item.title: Manager ins and outs - 2025-26 season
item.description: BBC Sport tracks all the manager ins and outs in the Premier League, Scottish Premiership, Women's Super League, English Football League and National League.

item.title: Who is Wilfried Nancy?
item.description: Our Ask Me Anything team take a look who MLS manager Wilfried Nancy is.

item.title: Why VAR gets involved in some penalties but not others
item.description: It was a weekend of VAR penalty decisions in the Premier League, with spot-kicks awarded, cancelled and ignored. BBC Sport explains why.

item.title: Why can Channel Islands players play for England?
item.description: Our Ask Me Anything team look at why players born in the Channel Islands like Alex Scott can represent England at a senior level.

item.title: What is the Fifa Peace Prize?
item.description: Our Ask Me Anything team explain what the Fifa Peace Prize is and why US President Donald Trump is being tipped for the award.

item.title: What are the Fifa Best Awards?
item.description: Our Ask Me Anything team explain what the Fifa Best Awards are, who can vote and who the nominees are.

item.title: Why do footballers tape up their wrists?
item.description: Our Ask Me Anything team explains why footballers use tape to wrap their wrists.

item.title: Who are the youngest Champions League players?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything team looks at the youngest players have ever played in the Champions League

item.title: Foley aims to sell Hibs stake back to Gordon family
item.description: Bill Foley is in the process of selling his 25% stake in Hibernian back to the club's majority shareholder, the Gordon family, after the pair agree the partnership is not working for either party.

item.title: 'Everything is possible' for Hearts - Braga
item.description: Claudio Braga believes "everything is possible" with Hearts top of the Scottish Premiership after playing 12 of their 38 fixtures.

item.title: Ajax to sack former Liverpool coach Heitinga
item.description: Ajax have sacked manager John Heitinga after 15 matches and less than six months after he joined the club from Liverpool.

item.title: Watch live Bundesliga games on Friday nights on the BBC
item.description: BBC Sport announce broadcasting rights for Bundesliga matches for the 2025-26 and 2026-27 seasons.

item.title: Inside Bellingham's tough start at Dortmund
item.description: Jobe Bellingham impressed after first arriving at Borussia Dortmund in the summer, but has since struggled to find his best form.

item.title: How Kompany turned Bayern into a formidable force
item.description: Bayern Munich are the only unbeaten team across Europe's top five leagues, but how has Vincent Kompany turned them into a formidable force?

item.title: Players in tears as coach dies during match
item.description: Mladen Zizovic, manager of Serbian top-flight side FK Radnicki 1923, dies after collapsing during a match.

item.title: From farming village to Liverpool icon - the Salah story
item.description: BBC Sport visits Egypt to discover what Mohamed Salah means to the people of the football-mad country, and how a small boy from humble beginnings became a national icon.

item.title: Napoli 'smell blood' & target Premier League's discarded stars
item.description: After Scott McTominay was a hit, Napoli went back to the Premier League for Kevin de Bruyne, could more players follow them to Serie A?

item.title: How does Daniel Levy run Tottenham - and would he ever leave?
item.description: With Tottenham struggling on the pitch and chairman Daniel Levy facing criticism from fans, BBC Sport looks at how the club is run and what the future might hold.

item.title: When River Plate icon Diaz took over fourth-tier Oxford
item.description: Twenty years on from Ramon Diaz's surprising appointment at Oxford United, BBC Sport looks at what happened and how it went.

item.title: East meets west London - the mentor who changed Chelsea
item.description: Vinay Menon knew nothing about football when he went for a meeting at a west London mansion in 2009. A few weeks later he was in the heart of the Chelsea dressing room.

item.title: The air crash and the underdogs - a triumph for a lost generation
item.description: Nineteen years and 10 miles separated Zambia's football team from a lost, golden generation on a fateful night in Libreville.

item.title: The rise and fall of North Korea - the sleeping giant of women's football
item.description: North Korea lags behind most of the rest of the world in several areas. But the hermit state has had an outsized impact on international women's football.
